    • Field Detail

      • searchServiceId

        public java.lang.String searchServiceId
        A string used to uniquely identify a Search Service.

      • extKeyName

        public java.lang.String extKeyName
        The name of a Search Service Field that will uniquely identify each record in an Index created from this Search Service definition. It is essential that values in the Index corresponding to this Search Service Field be unique, as when searchable data is updated in the Curam database, the value of this field will be used to identify the appropriate Document to be updated in the Index.

      • analyzer

        public java.lang.String analyzer
        The Search Service analyzer to be used when converting from Curam database text terms to Index terms. The contents of this column should denote one of the predefined analyzer names provided by the Generic Search Server (see the list below) or a fully qualified Java classname of a class that implements the abstract class org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer. This may be either a standard Lucene analyzer or a third-party or custom implementation. Note that the class must be available on the Generic Search Server classpath if it is not a standard Lucene analyzer. The Generic Search Server provides the following predefined analyzers. STANDARD Splits text at punctuation characters, removing punctuation. However, a dot that's not followed by whitespace is considered part of a token. Splits words at hyphens, unless there's a number in the token, in which case the whole token is interpreted as a product number and is not split. Recognizes email addresses and internet hostnames as one token. Normalizes token text to lower case and removes common English stop words. SIMPLE Splits text at non-letter characters and normalizes token text to lower case. STOP Curam Generic Search Server 14 Splits text at non-letter characters, normalizes token text to lower case and removes common English stop words. WHITESPACE Splits text at whitespace. Adjacent sequences of non-Whitespace characters form tokens. KEYWORD \"Tokenizes\" the entire stream as a single token. This is useful for data like zip codes, ids, and some product names.

      • frcedReidxTimeStmp

        public DateTime frcedReidxTimeStmp
        Used by the Extractor to force the Generic Search Server to rebuild its Indices after an extract has been run. When creating Search Service records, this should be initially set to null.

      • mapperName

        public java.lang.String mapperName
        The name of the mapper implementation (see GSS Developer's Guide, Implement Mapper Operations). A Mapper implementation is a class that converts a set of Curam entity data to a format suitable for indexing. The value of this column should be the fully qualified classname of the Mapper class, and as with the Analyzer implementation, this should be on the Generic Search Server runtime classpath (If the Mapper is developed as part of the Curam application it will be on the classpath by default).

        MAPPER_NAME_STRING -> String

      • dbLastWritten

        public DateTime dbLastWritten
        The time the persisted index was last written to the database. Used to allow the persisted index to be supplemented with more recent data when starting up.

      • prstBlobSize

        public java.lang.String prstBlobSize
        The blob size to be used when persisting this search service.
